Description: Neck sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery volute-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: two black-figure friezes with chariots, to right, separated by single band; above, legs of horses only; below, much of team and part of charioteer (head with added red band, shoulders and arms, wearing added white garment, and holding goad in right hand).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel, see the volute-krater in Warsaw 302548 (ABV, 194, no. 1).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 286, no. B257)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0178) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (P. 96, pl. III, no. 8)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
